title: Creating a reading list of articles on syntax in end-to-end models, particularly focusing on syntactic parsing, semantic role labeling, and machine translation, involves selecting influential and insightful papers. Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2021 that you might find useful
- This foundational paper introduces the Transformer model, which has become central to many NLP tasks, including machine translation
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Devlin et al
- Discusses BERT, a model that has influenced syntactic parsing and semantic role labeling
**"Universal Dependencies: A Cross-Linguistic Perspective on Syntax"** by Nivre et al
- Explores the Universal Dependencies framework, which is crucial for syntactic parsing
- Introduces ELMo, which has applications in syntactic parsing and semantic role labeling
**"End-to-End Neural Coreference Resolution"** by Lee et al
- While focused on coreference, this paper's methods are relevant to syntactic and semantic tasks
**"A Fast and Accurate Dependency Parser using Neural Networks"** by Chen and Manning
- Discusses a neural network approach to dependency parsing
**"Neural Machine Translation by Jointly Learning to Align and Translate"** by Bahdanau et al
- Introduces the attention mechanism in the context of machine translation
The World's Most Accurate Parser"** by Weiss et al
- Describes Google's SyntaxNet, a neural network-based syntactic parser
**"Semantic Role Labeling with Associated Memory Network"** by He et al
- Focuses on semantic role labeling using memory networks
- Provides an overview of semantic parsing techniques, including end-to-end models
**"Tree-LSTM: A Flexible Model for Semantic Compositionality over a Tree Structure"** by Tai et al
- Discusses a model that captures syntactic structure in semantic tasks
**"Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** by Raffel et al
- Introduces T5, a model applicable to various NLP tasks, including parsing and translation
**"Constituency Parsing with a Self-Attentive Encoder"** by Kitaev and Klein
- Focuses on constituency parsing using self-attention mechanisms
**"A Simple and Accurate Syntax-Agnostic Neural Model for Dependency Parsing"** by Dozat and Manning
- Proposes a syntax-agnostic approach to dependency parsing
**"Semantic Role Labeling for Open Information Extraction"** by Stanovsky et al
- Discusses semantic role labeling in the context of information extraction
**"Neural Architectures for Named Entity Recognition"** by Lample et al
- While focused on NER, the techniques are relevant to syntactic and semantic tasks
**"Multilingual Neural Machine Translation with Soft Decoupled Encoding"** by Wang et al
- Explores multilingual NMT with implications for syntactic and semantic understanding
**"Jointly Predicting Predicates and Arguments in Neural Semantic Role Labeling"** by He et al
- Discusses a joint model for semantic role labeling
**"Dependency Parsing with Bi-Directional LSTM-CNNs"** by Kiperwasser and Goldberg
- Combines LSTMs and CNNs for dependency parsing
**"Syntax-Aware Neural Semantic Role Labeling"** by Strubell et al
- Integrates syntactic information into neural models for semantic role labeling
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the developments in syntactic parsing, semantic role labeling, and machine translation using end-to-end models
